  47@registry.register
  48class Stone(
  49    ContactInteractionMixin,
  50    InertiaPrincipleWithFrictionEvolution,
  51    GameObject,
  52    MovementAnimationMixin,
  53    StandingAnimationMixin,
  54    DamageHealthByTemperature,
  55    DamageHealthByInertia,
  56    HeatInteractionMixin,
  57    RenderMixin,
  58    DeathMixin,
  59    DeathAnimationMixin,
  60):
  61    def __init__(self, x: int, y: int, name: str, health: float, **kwargs: Any):
  62        super().__init__(x, y, name, health)
  63        self.friction_coefficient = 1
  64        self.noise_intensity = 0.1
  65        self.inertia_threshold_to_hurt_upper = 1
  66        self.attractiveness = 0.1
  67        self.visible_size = 0.5
  68        self.z_level = 1.0
  69        self.mass = 200
  70        self.health = 10
  71        self.is_encumbrant = True
  72        self.num_animations = 4  # do not forget this when inheriting from MovementAnimationMixin
  73        self.num_animations_standing = 1
  74        self.num_animations_dying = 8
  75        # Load sprites
  76        self.movement_sprites_locations = {
  77            Direction.UP: [
  78                f"assets/sprites/boulder/up_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
  79            ],
  80            Direction.DOWN: [
  81                f"assets/sprites/boulder/down_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
  82            ],
  83            Direction.LEFT: [
  84                f"assets/sprites/boulder/left_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
  85            ],
  86            Direction.RIGHT: [
  87                f"assets/sprites/boulder/right_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
  88            ],
  89        }
  90        self.dying_sprites_locations = {
  91            Direction.UP: [
  92                f"assets/sprites/boulder/rock_crumble_{i+1}.png"
  93                for i in range(self.num_animations_dying)
  94            ],
  95            Direction.DOWN: [
  96                f"assets/sprites/boulder/rock_crumble_{i+1}.png"
  97                for i in range(self.num_animations_dying)
  98            ],
  99            Direction.LEFT: [
 100                f"assets/sprites/boulder/rock_crumble_{i+1}.png"
 101                for i in range(self.num_animations_dying)
 102            ],
 103            Direction.RIGHT: [
 104                f"assets/sprites/boulder/rock_crumble_{i+1}.png"
 105                for i in range(self.num_animations_dying)
 106            ],
 107        }
 108        self.standing_sprites_locations = [
 109            {
 110                Direction.UP: [
 111                    f"assets/sprites/boulder/up_{i}.png"
 112                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
 113                ],
 114                Direction.DOWN: [
 115                    f"assets/sprites/boulder/down_{i}.png"
 116                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
 117                ],
 118                Direction.LEFT: [
 119                    f"assets/sprites/boulder/left_{i}.png"
 120                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
 121                ],
 122                Direction.RIGHT: [
 123                    f"assets/sprites/boulder/right_{i}.png"
 124                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
 125                ],
 126            }
 127        ]
 128        self.__post_init__()  # do not forget

 181class FireBall(
 182    InertiaPrincipleWithFrictionEvolution,
 183    GameObject,
 184    MovementAnimationMixin,
 185    RenderMixin,
 186    DamageHealthByTemperature,
 187    HeatDissipation,
 188    DamageHealthByInertia,
 189    HeatInteractionMixin,
 190    DeathMixin,
 191    DeathAnimationMixin,
 192    ExplodeAtTouch,
 193):
 194    def __init__(self, x: int, y: int, name: str, health: float, **kwargs: Any):
 195        super().__init__(x, y, name, health)
 196        self.friction_coefficient = 0.0
 197        self.noise_intensity = 0.1
 198        self.attractiveness = 0.1
 199        self.temperature_threshold_to_hurt_lower = 500
 200        self.temperature_threshold_to_hurt_upper = 10000000
 201        self.inertia_threshold_to_hurt_lower = 1
 202        self.visible_size = 0.5
 203        self.temperature = 10000
 204        self.health = 1
 205        self.inertia = 2.0
 206        self.is_moving = True  # by design
 207        self.z_level = 1.0
 208        self.ignore_walkable = True
 209        self.num_animations = 16  # do nnot forget this when inheriting from MovementAnimationMixin
 210        self.num_animations_dying = 7
 211        # Load sprites
 212        self.movement_sprites_locations = {
 213            Direction.UP: [
 214                f"assets/sprites/fireball/up_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
 215            ],
 216            Direction.DOWN: [
 217                f"assets/sprites/fireball/down_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
 218            ],
 219            Direction.LEFT: [
 220                f"assets/sprites/fireball/left_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
 221            ],
 222            Direction.RIGHT: [
 223                f"assets/sprites/fireball/right_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
 224            ],
 225        }
 226        self.dying_sprites_locations = {
 227            Direction.UP: [
 228                f"assets/sprites/explosion/tile_0_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_dying)
 229            ],
 230            Direction.DOWN: [
 231                f"assets/sprites/explosion/tile_0_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_dying)
 232            ],
 233            Direction.LEFT: [
 234                f"assets/sprites/explosion/tile_0_{i}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_dying)
 235            ],
 236            Direction.RIGHT: [

 243@registry.register
 244class Ground(GameObject, StandingAnimationMixin, RenderMixin, EncumbranceMixin):
 245    def __init__(self, x: int, y: int, name: str, health: float, tile_name: str, **kwargs: Any):
 246        super().__init__(x, y, name, health)
 247        self.z_level = 0.0
 248        self.tile_name = tile_name
 249        self.num_animations_standing = 1
 250        self.scheduler.interval = 0.01
 251        self.actions_per_second = 9  # should be high, more than the player at least
 252        self.is_walkable = True  # used for encumbrance
 253
 254        # Extract NSWE neighbor tuple from the last 4 components of the name
 255        parts = self.tile_name.split("_")
 256        try:
 257            self.nswe_neigh = tuple(int(n) for n in parts[-4:])
 258        except ValueError:
 259            raise ValueError(f"Tile name '{tile_name}' does not end with four numeric components")
 260        self.standing_sprites_locations = [
 261            {
 262                Direction.UP: [
 263                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
 264                ],
 265                Direction.DOWN: [
 266                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
 267                ],
 268                Direction.LEFT: [
 269                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
 270                ],
 271                Direction.RIGHT: [
 272                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
 273                ],
 274            }
 275        ]
 276        self.__post_init__()  # do not forget
 277

 280class RobeTorso(
 281    GameObject,
 282    MovementAnimationMixin,
 283    StandingAnimationMixin,
 284    RenderMixin,
 285):
 286    def __init__(self, x: int, y: int, name: str, health: float, **kwargs: Any):
 287        super().__init__(x, y, name, health)
 288        self.noise_intensity = 0.1
 289        self.attractiveness = 1.1
 290        self.visible_size = 0.5
 291        self.num_animations = 8
 292        self.num_animations_standing = 1
 293        self.location_as_parent = True  # just set this for objects to stick to parent
 294        self.actions_per_second = 6
 295        self.render_on_top_of_parent = True
 296        self.scheduler.interval = 0.1  # NOTE: needed to keep on top of the player
 297        self.is_grabbable = True
 298
 299        # Load sprites
 300        self.movement_sprites_locations = {
 301            Direction.UP: [
 302                f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_0_{i+1}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
 303            ],
 304            Direction.DOWN: [
 305                f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_2_{i+1}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
 306            ],
 307            Direction.LEFT: [
 308                f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_1_{i+1}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
 309            ],
 310            Direction.RIGHT: [
 311                f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_3_{i+1}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
 312            ],
 313        }
 314        self.standing_sprites_locations = [
 315            {
 316                Direction.UP: [
 317                    f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_0_{i}.png"
 318                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
 319                ],
 320                Direction.DOWN: [
 321                    f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_2_{i}.png"
 322                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)

 941@registry.register
 942class Baloon(
 943    GameObject,
 944    HealthDecreasesEvolution,
 945    StandingAnimationMixin,
 946    MovementAnimationMixin,
 947    RenderMixin,
 948    DeathMixin,
 949):
 950    def __init__(self, x: int, y: int, name: str, health: float, speech: str, **kwargs: Any):
 951        super().__init__(x, y, name, health)
 952        self.speech = speech
 953        self.z_level = 100.0
 954        self.actions_per_second = 3
 955        self.location_as_parent = True
 956        self.num_animations_standing = 1
 957        self.num_animations = 1
 958        self.sprite_size_y = 128
 959        # Load sprites
 960        self.__post_init__()  # do not forget
 961
 962    def create_movement_sprites(self) -> None:
 963        self.movement_sprites = {
 964            Direction.UP: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 965            Direction.DOWN: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 966            Direction.LEFT: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 967            Direction.RIGHT: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 968        }
 969
 970    def create_standing_sprites(self) -> None:
 971        self.standing_sprites = [
 972            {
 973                Direction.UP: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 974                Direction.DOWN: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 975                Direction.LEFT: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 976                Direction.RIGHT: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 977            }
 978        ]
 979
 980    def make_balloon_surface(self) -> pygame.Surface:
 981        font = pygame.font.SysFont(None, 18)
 982        padding = 10
 983        line_spacing = 4  # Space between lines
 984
 985        # Split text into lines
 986        lines = self.speech.split("\n")
 987
 988        # Render each line and measure size
 989        rendered_lines = [font.render(line, True, BLACK) for line in lines]
 990        max_width = max(line.get_width() for line in rendered_lines)
 991        total_height = sum(line.get_height() for line in rendered_lines) + line_spacing * (
 992            len(lines) - 1
 993        )
 994
 995        # Create surface with proper size
 996        balloon_width = max_width + 2 * padding
 997        balloon_height = total_height + 2 * padding
 998        balloon_surface = pygame.Surface((balloon_width, balloon_height), pygame.SRCALPHA)
 999
1000        # Draw the rounded rectangle (the balloon)
1001        pygame.draw.rect(balloon_surface, WHITE, balloon_surface.get_rect(), border_radius=15)
1002
1003        # Blit lines onto the surface
1004        y_offset = padding
1005        for line_surface in rendered_lines:
1006            balloon_surface.blit(line_surface, (padding, y_offset))
1007            y_offset += line_surface.get_height() + line_spacing
1008        self.sprite_size_y = 100 + balloon_surface.get_height()
1009
1010        return balloon_surface
1011

1066
1067    def trigger_event(self, game) -> None:
1068        """
1069        This event consists in creating a baloon and spawning items on the floor in the exact position of the self.
1070        """
1071        if self.closed:
1072            self.closed = False
1073            baloon = registry.create(
1074                cls_name="Baloon",
1075                x=self.x,
1076                y=self.y,
1077                name="baloon",
1078                health=100,
1079                speech="Grandpa wrote a short note, saying that he closed the way north to avoid spreading\nthe frogs invasion: he would like me to go there and remove those pests.\nHe also mentioned to wear these magical robe to be able to move the rock.",
1080            )
1081            game.current_level.register(baloon)
1082            robe = registry.create(
1083                cls_name="RobeTorso",
1084                x=self.x,
1085                y=self.y,  # NOTE: maybe put + 1 here
1086                name="granda's robe",
1087                health=10,
1088            )
1089            game.current_level.register(robe)
1090            # make chest open
1091            self.current_standing_idx = 1

This is a very complex function, as it has to work properly online and on single player. The logic is to get the least amount of items from teh server, that may make the animation lag. The idea is to check if the last time this function was called, the target positions are the same or changed. This is the reason for the variables last_x, last_y and x, y. However, an additional complexity comes from all teh objects that should be bounded to stay attached to an object. Especially in multiplayer, we cannot rely on the server: hence, we propose here to overwrite the parameters of the children with those of the parent. A final complexity comes from the fact that the parent may have entered the movement mixin before or after the children, thus creating a "positional tick" of difference that may be very disturbing. To solve this, we try to estimate who passed first through this mixin.

244@registry.register
245class Ground(GameObject, StandingAnimationMixin, RenderMixin, EncumbranceMixin):
246    def __init__(self, x: int, y: int, name: str, health: float, tile_name: str, **kwargs: Any):
247        super().__init__(x, y, name, health)
248        self.z_level = 0.0
249        self.tile_name = tile_name
250        self.num_animations_standing = 1
251        self.scheduler.interval = 0.01
252        self.actions_per_second = 9  # should be high, more than the player at least
253        self.is_walkable = True  # used for encumbrance
254
255        # Extract NSWE neighbor tuple from the last 4 components of the name
256        parts = self.tile_name.split("_")
257        try:
258            self.nswe_neigh = tuple(int(n) for n in parts[-4:])
259        except ValueError:
260            raise ValueError(f"Tile name '{tile_name}' does not end with four numeric components")
261        self.standing_sprites_locations = [
262            {
263                Direction.UP: [
264                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
265                ],
266                Direction.DOWN: [
267                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
268                ],
269                Direction.LEFT: [
270                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
271                ],
272                Direction.RIGHT: [
273                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
274                ],
275            }
276        ]
277        self.__post_init__()  # do not forget

This mixin prevent movements in the location of self. This has to be attached to the Ground objects.

Ground( x: int, y: int, name: str, health: float, tile_name: str, **kwargs: Any)

248        self.z_level = 0.0
249        self.tile_name = tile_name
250        self.num_animations_standing = 1
251        self.scheduler.interval = 0.01
252        self.actions_per_second = 9  # should be high, more than the player at least
253        self.is_walkable = True  # used for encumbrance
254
255        # Extract NSWE neighbor tuple from the last 4 components of the name
256        parts = self.tile_name.split("_")
257        try:
258            self.nswe_neigh = tuple(int(n) for n in parts[-4:])
259        except ValueError:
260            raise ValueError(f"Tile name '{tile_name}' does not end with four numeric components")
261        self.standing_sprites_locations = [
262            {
263                Direction.UP: [
264                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
265                ],
266                Direction.DOWN: [
267                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
268                ],
269                Direction.LEFT: [
270                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
271                ],
272                Direction.RIGHT: [
273                    f"{self.tile_name}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
274                ],
275            }
276        ]
277        self.__post_init__()  # do not forget

x, y are the positions

280@registry.register
281class RobeTorso(
282    GameObject,
283    MovementAnimationMixin,
284    StandingAnimationMixin,
285    RenderMixin,
286):
287    def __init__(self, x: int, y: int, name: str, health: float, **kwargs: Any):
288        super().__init__(x, y, name, health)
289        self.noise_intensity = 0.1
290        self.attractiveness = 1.1
291        self.visible_size = 0.5
292        self.num_animations = 8
293        self.num_animations_standing = 1
294        self.location_as_parent = True  # just set this for objects to stick to parent
295        self.actions_per_second = 6
296        self.render_on_top_of_parent = True
297        self.scheduler.interval = 0.1  # NOTE: needed to keep on top of the player
298        self.is_grabbable = True
299
300        # Load sprites
301        self.movement_sprites_locations = {
302            Direction.UP: [
303                f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_0_{i+1}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
304            ],
305            Direction.DOWN: [
306                f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_2_{i+1}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
307            ],
308            Direction.LEFT: [
309                f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_1_{i+1}.png" for i in range(self.num_animations)
310            ],
311            Direction.RIGHT: [

313            ],
314        }

316            {
317                Direction.UP: [
318                    f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_0_{i}.png"
319                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
320                ],
321                Direction.DOWN: [
322                    f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_2_{i}.png"
323                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
324                ],
325                Direction.LEFT: [
326                    f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_1_{i}.png"
327                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
328                ],
329                Direction.RIGHT: [
330                    f"assets/sprites/robe_torso/tile_3_{i}.png"
331                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
332                ],
333            }
334        ]
335        self.__post_init__()  # do not forget

This is a very complex function, as it has to work properly online and on single player. The logic is to get the least amount of items from teh server, that may make the animation lag. The idea is to check if the last time this function was called, the target positions are the same or changed. This is the reason for the variables last_x, last_y and x, y. However, an additional complexity comes from all teh objects that should be bounded to stay attached to an object. Especially in multiplayer, we cannot rely on the server: hence, we propose here to overwrite the parameters of the children with those of the parent. A final complexity comes from the fact that the parent may have entered the movement mixin before or after the children, thus creating a "positional tick" of difference that may be very disturbing. To solve this, we try to estimate who passed first through this mixin.

489        self.standing_sprites_locations = [
490            {
491                Direction.UP: [
492                    f"assets/sprites/skirt/tile_0_{i}.png"
493                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
494                ],
495                Direction.DOWN: [
496                    f"assets/sprites/skirt/tile_2_{i}.png"
497                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
498                ],
499                Direction.LEFT: [
500                    f"assets/sprites/skirt/tile_1_{i}.png"
501                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
502                ],
503                Direction.RIGHT: [
504                    f"assets/sprites/skirt/tile_3_{i}.png"
505                    for i in range(self.num_animations_standing)
506                ],
507            }
508        ]
509        self.__post_init__()  # do not forget

This is a very complex function, as it has to work properly online and on single player. The logic is to get the least amount of items from teh server, that may make the animation lag. The idea is to check if the last time this function was called, the target positions are the same or changed. This is the reason for the variables last_x, last_y and x, y. However, an additional complexity comes from all teh objects that should be bounded to stay attached to an object. Especially in multiplayer, we cannot rely on the server: hence, we propose here to overwrite the parameters of the children with those of the parent. A final complexity comes from the fact that the parent may have entered the movement mixin before or after the children, thus creating a "positional tick" of difference that may be very disturbing. To solve this, we try to estimate who passed first through this mixin.

701        self.num_animations = 1
702        # self.scheduler.interval = 0.1
703        self.sprite_size_x: int = 128
704        self.sprite_size_y: int = 128
705        self.location_as_parent = True  # just set this for objects to stick to parent
706
707        # Load sprites
708        self.movement_sprites_locations = {
709            Direction.UP: [f"assets/sprites/cow_shadow/up.png"],
710            Direction.DOWN: [f"assets/sprites/cow_shadow/down.png"],
711            Direction.LEFT: [f"assets/sprites/cow_shadow/left.png"],
712            Direction.RIGHT: [f"assets/sprites/cow_shadow/right.png"],
713        }
714        self.standing_sprites_locations = [
715            {
716                Direction.UP: [f"assets/sprites/cow_shadow/up.png"],
717                Direction.DOWN: [f"assets/sprites/cow_shadow/down.png"],
718                Direction.LEFT: [f"assets/sprites/cow_shadow/left.png"],
719                Direction.RIGHT: [f"assets/sprites/cow_shadow/right.png"],
720            }
721        ]
722        self.__post_init__()  # do not forget

This is a very complex function, as it has to work properly online and on single player. The logic is to get the least amount of items from teh server, that may make the animation lag. The idea is to check if the last time this function was called, the target positions are the same or changed. This is the reason for the variables last_x, last_y and x, y. However, an additional complexity comes from all teh objects that should be bounded to stay attached to an object. Especially in multiplayer, we cannot rely on the server: hence, we propose here to overwrite the parameters of the children with those of the parent. A final complexity comes from the fact that the parent may have entered the movement mixin before or after the children, thus creating a "positional tick" of difference that may be very disturbing. To solve this, we try to estimate who passed first through this mixin.

class Baloon(flatland.objects.base_objects.GameObject, flatland.interactions.evolution.HealthDecreasesEvolution, flatland.animations.animations.StandingAnimationMixin, flatland.animations.animations.MovementAnimationMixin, flatland.animations.render.RenderMixin, flatland.interactions.evolution.DeathMixin): 
 942@registry.register
 943class Baloon(
 944    GameObject,
 945    HealthDecreasesEvolution,
 946    StandingAnimationMixin,
 947    MovementAnimationMixin,
 948    RenderMixin,
 949    DeathMixin,
 950):
 951    def __init__(self, x: int, y: int, name: str, health: float, speech: str, **kwargs: Any):
 952        super().__init__(x, y, name, health)
 953        self.speech = speech
 954        self.z_level = 100.0
 955        self.actions_per_second = 3
 956        self.location_as_parent = True
 957        self.num_animations_standing = 1
 958        self.num_animations = 1
 959        self.sprite_size_y = 128
 960        # Load sprites
 961        self.__post_init__()  # do not forget
 962
 963    def create_movement_sprites(self) -> None:
 964        self.movement_sprites = {
 965            Direction.UP: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 966            Direction.DOWN: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 967            Direction.LEFT: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 968            Direction.RIGHT: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 969        }
 970
 971    def create_standing_sprites(self) -> None:
 972        self.standing_sprites = [
 973            {
 974                Direction.UP: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 975                Direction.DOWN: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 976                Direction.LEFT: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 977                Direction.RIGHT: [self.make_balloon_surface()],
 978            }
 979        ]
 980
 981    def make_balloon_surface(self) -> pygame.Surface:
 982        font = pygame.font.SysFont(None, 18)
 983        padding = 10
 984        line_spacing = 4  # Space between lines
 985
 986        # Split text into lines
 987        lines = self.speech.split("\n")
 988
 989        # Render each line and measure size
 990        rendered_lines = [font.render(line, True, BLACK) for line in lines]
 991        max_width = max(line.get_width() for line in rendered_lines)
 992        total_height = sum(line.get_height() for line in rendered_lines) + line_spacing * (
 993            len(lines) - 1
 994        )
 995
 996        # Create surface with proper size
 997        balloon_width = max_width + 2 * padding
 998        balloon_height = total_height + 2 * padding
 999        balloon_surface = pygame.Surface((balloon_width, balloon_height), pygame.SRCALPHA)
1000
1001        # Draw the rounded rectangle (the balloon)
1002        pygame.draw.rect(balloon_surface, WHITE, balloon_surface.get_rect(), border_radius=15)
1003
1004        # Blit lines onto the surface
1005        y_offset = padding
1006        for line_surface in rendered_lines:
1007            balloon_surface.blit(line_surface, (padding, y_offset))
1008            y_offset += line_surface.get_height() + line_spacing
1009        self.sprite_size_y = 100 + balloon_surface.get_height()
1010
1011        return balloon_surface

1068    def trigger_event(self, game) -> None:
1069        """
1070        This event consists in creating a baloon and spawning items on the floor in the exact position of the self.
1071        """
1072        if self.closed:
1073            self.closed = False
1074            baloon = registry.create(
1075                cls_name="Baloon",
1076                x=self.x,
1077                y=self.y,
1078                name="baloon",
1079                health=100,
1080                speech="Grandpa wrote a short note, saying that he closed the way north to avoid spreading\nthe frogs invasion: he would like me to go there and remove those pests.\nHe also mentioned to wear these magical robe to be able to move the rock.",
1081            )
1082            game.current_level.register(baloon)
1083            robe = registry.create(
1084                cls_name="RobeTorso",
1085                x=self.x,
1086                y=self.y,  # NOTE: maybe put + 1 here
1087                name="granda's robe",
1088                health=10,
1089            )
1090            game.current_level.register(robe)
1091            # make chest open
1092            self.current_standing_idx = 1
